On Tuesday, Feb 18, 2003, at 07:59 US/Central, 
dave.cantrell@... wrote:

> what good is a URI which points to nothing (ex: the various "urn"
> schemes) since it is not available via the HTTP verbs, and therefore 
> is an
> island unto itself, creating exactly the problem REST opposes?

A URI, even an HTTP URI, that cannot be dereferenced nonetheless 
provides a unique name for an abstract resource that can be 
distinguished from all other names for resources.

jb
